revised_title: Marsupial Pouches, Mammary Glands, and Mammary Foetus in Echidna Hystrix
tldr: The author examines the reproductive system and development of the Echidna Hystrix, a monotreme, and discovers similarities to marsupials and differences from other mammals. The study focuses on the marsupial pouches, mammary glands, and the mammary foetus, providing insights into the reproductive biology of this unique species.
